item.title: WSL 2 and docker compose
item.description: With the arrival of WSL 2 (Windows Subsystem for Linux), I thought it was a good time to learn more about this technology. I am surprised at the possibilities this offers. So let’s dive into this and use WSL 2 and Docker-Compose to fire up some containers to present sensor data in a Grafana dashboard.

item.title: Leverage the power of Azure
item.description: Combine the power of azure functions within PowerAutomate for unprecedented possibilities.

item.title: Power Automate
item.description: Create a PDF file from a SharePoint list item using the no-code Microsoft Power Automate Platform.

item.description: In this post I will do a write-up of my current project: having fun with LoRaWAN.

item.title: Superheroes
item.description: Want to get started developing AngularJS / TypeScript applications using Visual Studio Code? In this blogpost I will show you how to get started in less time than a coffee break.

item.title: Home automation explained
item.description: In this post I will explain how you can create your home automation system using a simple Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Controlling a VFD with an ESP8266
item.description: In this project I have build an information-display using an ESP8266 to control a Vacuum Fluorescent Display (VFD).

item.title: PowerShell security measures you should know about
item.description: I use PowerShell a lot to make life easier as a developer. Also for system administrators PowerShell can be a great solution for various tasks. There are little things that cannot be done using PowerShell when you would compare it to for example an executable file. Microsoft made some security measures to protect you from running any malicious PowerShell scripts and in this article I will summarise the information I found regarding this topic.

item.title: SharePoint listdata generator
item.description: Testing your application with large numbers of data is important but sadly often forgotten. SharePoint is no exception to this rule.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Background

I am a passionate developer with experience in many different roles. Through acquired skills and knowledge in a large number of projects, I have experience in architecture design, development and management activities. Key words: analytical, careful, competent, positive attitude and sense of humor.

Interests

Always looking for opportunities to use my knowledge about computer science in technical applications. From personal interest I am working on IOT, Domotica and 3d printing. Designing and creating applications with ESP8266, Raspberry and Arduinos is therefore something I enjoy doing. You can find me at knowledge sessions on this topic via meetup.com.
